shortlist.name: Fasol
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.1 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and a win last season. Trained by Paul Nicholls and ridden by Harry Cobden, both highly respected at this level. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse's proven ability in similar company. No signs of regression in form and connections are in excellent form.

shortlist.name: Frontier Prince
shortlist.odds_note: 2/1 SBK, 3.55 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent runner-up finish on seasonal return, indicating fitness and readiness. Fergal O'Brien is a trainer with a strong record at Chepstow, and Jonathan Burke is a reliable jockey. Form is solid and the horse is expected to be competitive again at this level.

shortlist.name: Masked Man (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with strong jockey-trainer partnership. Family connection suggests confidence despite blank form string indicating absence. Odds suggest serious market support and insider confidence.

shortlist.name: Tashan
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with two wins from three runs (211). Harry Cobden booking is significant positive. Proven winning form demonstrates current peak condition and consistency. Strong each-way value.

shortlist.name: Doctors Hill
shortlist.rationale: Last run produced runner-up finish showing competitive form. Respected Hobbs yard excels with placed horses returning. Odds offer value against top two with realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Lahinch Wave (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.1 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid recent form figures, including a win and several competitive efforts in similar company. Trained by Neil Mulholland, who is reliable at this level, and partnered by an experienced jockey. No signs of regression in recent runs, and market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Somespring Special (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.9 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and several placed efforts in recent starts. The Hobbs/White yard is respected at Chepstow, and the horse has shown the ability to handle different scenarios. Recent form is reliable, and odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Springs A Girl (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 6 exchange (firmly in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals current well-being, and previous wins indicate ability at this level. Sean Bowen is a positive jockey booking. Consistent form and competitive odds make her a legitimate contender.

shortlist.name: Lord Accord (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.4 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level with recent form figures showing a return to competitiveness (second last time out). Proven stamina and ability to handle similar company. Trainer and jockey both reliable at Chepstow. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Courtland (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with three consecutive placings, indicating consistency and readiness. Connections are respected in staying chases. Market position suggests genuine expectation of a bold run.

shortlist.name: Le Milos
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 5.7 exchange (third choice in market, within value range)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, showing ability to go well fresh. Top connections (Skelton team) excel with similar types at this meeting. Form profile is progressive and odds offer fair value for a proven winner.

shortlist.name: Queensbury Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with multiple wins including latest start. Market leader with solid odds value. Proven at this level with consistent placings.

shortlist.name: Jack Hyde (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Latest win demonstrates current form progression. Strong connections with Fergal O'Brien yard. Consistent performer with multiple wins in recent runs showing upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Laravie (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptional recent form with four consecutive wins. On a hot streak and represents potential value at current odds despite double-digit price. Strong jockey-trainer combination.

shortlist.name: Sticktotheplan (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins show return to form after mid-season dip. Sean Bowen is a top-class jockey. Proven ability at this level with back-to-back wins showing current fitness.

shortlist.name: Double Powerful (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent, progressive form with a string of wins and places at a similar level; trainer and jockey are in good current form; odds represent solid value for a horse proven at this grade.

shortlist.name: Art Of Diplomacy
shortlist.rationale: On a steep upward curve with five consecutive wins, suggesting peak form; connections are in form and the horse is clearly thriving; current odds offer value for a horse in this kind of form.

shortlist.name: Welcom To Cartries (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Top connections and a solid, consistent profile; recent form is respectable if not spectacular, but the yard is in excellent form and the horse is proven at this level; odds are fair for a reliable contender.

shortlist.name: Lundi Noir (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Won sole start to date, suggesting significant potential; represents a trainer with a good record at this venue. Market support is notable and the unexposed profile is a positive in this field.

shortlist.name: Razzle Dazzle Boy (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with solid recent form figures and proven ability at this level. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Reliable profile compared to most rivals.

shortlist.name: Sweet Caryline
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a win last time, showing clear improvement and ability to go well fresh. Consistent profile last season, and the Tizzard yard is reliable at this venue. Odds reflect strong market support and realistic chance.

shortlist.name: La Belle Argentee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with clear scope for progress after a promising reappearance second. Top connections (Skelton/Skelton) are in form and excel with improving types at this time of year. Market position is justified.

shortlist.name: Roaring Home
shortlist.rationale: Returned with a solid second after a patchy but competitive campaign last season. Daly runners often improve for a run, and Twiston-Davies is a positive booking. Consistent at this level and odds are fair.

shortlist.name: Tarot
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and strong trainer-jockey combination. Recent performances suggest Tarot is in good shape.

shortlist.name: Albaydaa (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish indicates potential, and Haggas is a respected trainer. Odds suggest a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Valdorcia (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Third-place finish and Appleby's involvement make Valdorcia a viable option. Odds value is reasonable for its form.

shortlist.name: Fanjove (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Clear market leader with strong recent form showing progressive profile. Last-time-out winner (form figure 1) followed by consistent placed efforts (2, 4). Ed Dunlop yard in form and Rossa Ryan is a top-tier jockey. Short odds reflect genuine class edge over this field.

shortlist.name: Royalist (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third-place finish shows competitive form at this level. Richard Hughes is an astute trainer with strong strike-rate. At 6/1 offers each-way value as a legitimate place contender if market leader underperforms. Finley Marsh capable apprentice reducing weight burden.

shortlist.name: Project Incheon
shortlist.rationale: Archie Watson/Hollie Doyle combination is highly effective. Recent form figures (4, 2, 4) demonstrate consistency at this grade. Second-place finish two runs back indicates capability to compete with favourite. Well-backed at single-digit odds suggests stable confidence.

shortlist.name: Little She (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in recent runs, showing ability to place at this level. Connections are solid and market support is strong, indicating confidence. No major improvement needed; form is reliable for this grade.

shortlist.name: My Boy Harry
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes several placings and a win, demonstrating consistency and competitiveness. Odds offer reasonable value for a runner with proven ability at this level. Connections are capable and horse does not require significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Wesam (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last start, indicating current peak form; top connections in Saeed bin Suroor and Hector Crouch; odds reflect strong chance but still offer value for a horse with proven recent ability[1][4].

shortlist.name: Oursin
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with a recent second; trainer and jockey are reliable; odds are fair for a horse that is proven at this level and likely to be competitive again[1][4].

shortlist.name: Bay Of Light
shortlist.rationale: Unraced but from a top yard (Appleby); market support suggests ability; odds are respectful for a debutant with strong connections, but lacks proven form[4].

shortlist.name: Sunshine Star
shortlist.rationale: Debutant from elite Gosden stable commands strong market support as clear favourite. Connections have exceptional strike rate with first-time runners. Prominent jockey booking and price suggest readiness despite lack of form figures.

shortlist.name: Brighlee (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form showing clear progression (6th-2nd-2nd). Strong connections with Ryan and Menuisier partnership. Well-fancied at short odds indicating market confidence in continued improvement trajectory.

shortlist.name: Haddiah
shortlist.rationale: Another debutant from top-tier Balding yard with quality jockey Hornby aboard. Respected market position at 11/2 suggests stable confidence. Balding's proven record with newcomers warrants attention despite blank form.

shortlist.name: Absolute Star
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent win and placed efforts; top connections in Varian/Ryan; odds represent fair value for a horse proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Daisy Roots
shortlist.rationale: Won last two starts, showing clear progression; in-form trainer; current odds underestimate recent upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Waiting All Night
shortlist.rationale: Market leader but form is inconsistent; needs to bounce back from recent poor runs; respected connections but odds may be too short given recent efforts.

shortlist.name: Pride Of Donegal (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two 4ths and a 2nd, indicating reliability and readiness. Connections are strong, with a proven trainer and experienced jockey. Current odds reflect market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Bohemian Breeze (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile, regularly placing and winning. Recent form includes a win and multiple places, suggesting strong competitiveness at this level. Connections are reliable and odds offer reasonable value for a contender.

shortlist.name: Kingmaker (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.3 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, proven at this level, and represents a top trainer-jockey combination. No signs of regression and holds the best profile among the principals.

shortlist.name: My Kinda Ghaiy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 5.5 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently competitive in similar company, holding form well. Trainer is in good form and the odds reflect genuine win claims without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Me Tarzan (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.7 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple places and wins, indicating reliability and current fitness. Trained by James Fanshawe, a respected trainer, and ridden by George Wood. Market support confirms strong chance. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Dream Of Mischief
shortlist.rationale: Despite patchy form, has been running in competitive races and retains market respect. Rob Hornby is a capable jockey and Amanda Perrett is a solid trainer. Recent runs suggest potential to be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Brussels
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form in strong company, top connections, and a leading jockey. Recent placed efforts suggest he is at peak and ready to win, with the odds reflecting his chance but still offering value given the trainer's record and the horse's proven class.

shortlist.name: Revival Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last two starts, improving rapidly, and handles the track. Trainer and jockey are in form. The odds are fair for a progressive type who may still have more to offer.

shortlist.name: Calendar Girl
shortlist.rationale: Proven winning form (two wins from last three), arrives in peak condition, and represents a trainer in good form. Odds reflect strong market confidence and recent performances suggest reliability at this level.

shortlist.name: Classic Cuvee
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market; 4/1 SBK, 5.5 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from two starts, top-class jockey/trainer combination, and odds indicate solid support. Unexposed and open to further improvement.

shortlist.name: Mubasimah (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, top jockey booked, and trainer excels with similar types. Market respect and unbeaten status make her a legitimate contender if building on debut.

shortlist.name: Cosmic Year
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.35 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins from last six starts, including a strong sequence earlier this season. Recent form is solid, and the booking of top jockey C. T. Keane is a positive. Connections are in good form and the odds reflect strong market confidence. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Poet Master (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange (well-supported, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Proven at this level with multiple wins and a recent runner-up finish indicating a return to form. Trainer K. R. Burke is reliable in these events. The horse has shown the ability to bounce back after a layoff and is peaking at the right time. Odds suggest strong market respect.

shortlist.name: Precise (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with three consecutive wins and a second, representing top connections (Aidan O'Brien, Christophe Soumillon). The odds reflect strong confidence and the profile suggests the horse is at peak form, with no sign of regression. Reliable at this level and distance.

shortlist.name: Composing (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 (SBK), 4.6 (Exchange) – solid second choice in the market
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins and two placings in last six starts, also from the O'Brien yard. Recent form is solid, and odds indicate strong market respect. No major negatives in profile; proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Legacy Link
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 (SBK), 8.4 (Exchange) – third in market, not a longshot
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced improver from the Gosden stable, with a win and a place from two starts. Connections are highly respected, and the horse is open to further progress. Odds offer some value for a potential upward move, and the profile fits a typical contender at this level.

shortlist.name: Respond (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.9 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and a solid third last time out. Top jockey booking and trainer in good form. Consistent at this level and holds the best recent figures among the field. Market leader with justified support.

shortlist.name: Munsif (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.4 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Three wins from last five starts, including a recent victory. Trained by a top yard and remains unexposed at this level. Form suggests further improvement is possible and odds offer value relative to win record.

shortlist.name: Act Of Kindness
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 4/6 (1.75 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Showed promise on debut with a solid third, representing top connections (Appleby/Buick) who excel with juveniles at Newmarket. The market support is significant, and the horse is expected to improve for the run. No major negatives in the field and profile fits typical winning debutants for this yard.

shortlist.name: Falakeyah
shortlist.rationale: Clear market leader with recent victory form. Won last start decisively (1), showing peak form. Burrows stable in good form. Strong favorite status reflects solid credentials.

shortlist.name: Sand Gazelle
shortlist.rationale: Proven winner from powerful Gosden yard with elite jockey Murphy. Recent second shows competitive form at this level. Consistent record with multiple placings. Strong each-way contender.

shortlist.name: Spirited Style
shortlist.rationale: Godolphin runner with excellent recent form (2-1-1). Represents champion trainer Appleby. Three consecutive top-two finishes demonstrate consistency and progression. Value at current odds.

shortlist.name: Whip Cracker (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 (SBK), 8.0 (Exchange) – solid market position, not an outsider
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and current peak. Connections are in good order, and odds reflect genuine market respect without being overbet. No sign of regression in form cycle.

shortlist.name: Northern Express (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistently running in competitive handicaps, holding form well with several close finishes. Trainer and jockey are proven at this level. Odds indicate strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Bopedro (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly competitive in similar company, with multiple placings this season. Trainer excels with this type and Tudhope is a positive booking. Odds are fair for a horse with proven ability at the track and trip.

shortlist.name: Ghost Mode (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win last time out, indicating peak condition. Trained by Andrew Balding, a proven operator at York, and partnered by P. J. McDonald. Current odds reflect strong market support and suggest high confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Real American (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut win, suggesting significant potential and scope for further improvement. Trainer K. R. Burke is adept with progressive types at this level. Market odds indicate respect and expectation for a bold follow-up.

shortlist.name: Hornsea Bay
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.9 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer in competitive handicaps, holding form well with recent placings. Top connections and market leader status indicate strong confidence. No evidence of decline in recent runs, and profile fits a reliable, in-form contender at this level.

shortlist.name: Mukhtalif (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 5.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win and placed efforts, suggesting improvement and readiness. Trained by William Haggas, who excels at York, and partnered with a capable jockey. Odds reflect genuine winning chance without being overbet.

shortlist.name: Thaluna
shortlist.rationale: Thaluna is the clear market leader with odds indicating strong support and expectation of victory. The recent second-place finish shows reliable form and readiness, and the combination of top trainer William Haggas and capable jockey Cieren Fallon further boosts confidence. No signs of needing major improvement; should be at peak for this assignment[1][3][8].

shortlist.name: La Belle Forest (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: La Belle Forest is the only other runner with single-digit odds, suggesting market respect. While lacking racecourse form, the K. R. Burke yard is adept with debutantes and the odds imply positive expectations. Connections are strong and the market position warrants inclusion, though confidence is lower than Thaluna due to lack of proven form[3][8].

shortlist.name: Clear Force (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.7 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win in last six starts. Trainer Burke is reliable at York and the odds indicate strong market confidence. No signs of decline in form, and recent runs suggest peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Sands Of Spain (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins and a solid run of placed efforts. Trainer Balding is in good form and jockey McDonald is experienced. The odds reflect strong support and the horse has shown ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Utmost Respect (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.6 exchange (competitive odds, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent performances in competitive fields. Fahey is a proven trainer at York and the horse's form suggests it remains in good shape. Odds indicate genuine market respect.

shortlist.name: Kinswoman
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.8 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins and consistent recent placings. Trained by William Haggas, a top yard, and partnered by a reliable jockey. Profile suggests she is still progressing and well placed at this level.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.rationale: Very consistent profile with three wins and two recent placings. Proven ability to win and hold form, and connections are adept at placing horses in competitive handicaps. Should be in the mix again.

shortlist.name: Roach Power (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 9 exchange (respected in the market, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Has won two of last three starts and rarely runs a bad race. Consistent at this level and recent wins suggest he remains in top form. Trainer is capable with sprinters and the horse is proven over similar conditions.

shortlist.name: Quest For Fun
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 7.6 exchange (solid market support, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating reliability and current fitness. Trainer Tim Easterby is respected locally, and the odds suggest genuine market confidence. No signs of decline in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Vixey
shortlist.odds_note: 17/2 SBK, 13 exchange (still within competitive range, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent, with multiple wins and places in recent starts. Form figures show a horse at peak performance, and connections have placed her well. Odds offer value for a runner with such strong recent results.

shortlist.name: Luker's Tipple (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Very short odds (3/10 SBK, 1.38 exchange) indicate clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple runner-up finishes and a solid sixth last time; trained by Cromwell, a proven operator at this level. The horse has shown reliability and is not needing major improvement. Connections are strong and the market is heavily in favor.

shortlist.name: Black Gem (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (9/2 SBK, 6.8 exchange), clear gap to outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive (5th then 3rd), suggesting improvement and readiness for this contest. McConnell is a capable trainer and the odds reflect genuine place and win potential without requiring a major leap in ability.

shortlist.name: Derry Lad (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (exchange 2.22), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Represents a top yard with a strong record in similar contests. Despite a fall and an 8th last time, the market support is significant and suggests confidence from connections. The booking of Donagh Meyler is a positive, and the horse is likely to be primed for this assignment.

shortlist.name: Diamond Tipp (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 4/1 (exchange 2.28), well supported.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and a third in last three starts. Trained by John McConnell, who is adept at placing horses at this level. The horse is fit, in form, and has shown ability to handle similar company. Market position reflects realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Centaq (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows marked improvement with a strong second last time, indicating peaking condition. Connections are reliable and the horse is well-supported in the market, suggesting confidence from both public and professionals. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Someone's Wish (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/1 SBK, 3.35 Exchange (solid second choice on exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with placed efforts in competitive races. Top trainer and jockey combination adds further appeal. Exchange odds suggest genuine support, and the horse has shown enough ability to contend without needing a major leap in form.

shortlist.name: Pour Les Filles
shortlist.rationale: Gordon Elliott runner showing progressive form with recent second and consecutive thirds. Proven at the course/distance. Heavily backed to short odds reflecting strong market confidence. Elite trainer-jockey combination gives significant advantage in this weak field.

shortlist.name: Eco Pete (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with two thirds and a second in last four starts. Best price of 4/1 offers potential each-way value against the short-priced favourite. Recent runs suggest horse is holding form, though lacks the top-level connections of the market leader.

shortlist.name: Hitthehayson (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange favourite at 2.6, solid 4/1 with bookmakers.
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, having won last time out and showing progressive figures after a mid-season dip. The market support is strong, and the recent win suggests readiness. Connections are in good order and the jockey is reliable.

shortlist.name: Georgia Celena (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two places in last four starts before a fall. The fall last time is a concern but prior form is strong for this grade. Trainer is respected and the odds offer value.

shortlist.name: Tiny Angel (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Placed in two of last four starts, showing ability to compete at this level. Pulled up last time but prior consistency and market support suggest a return to form is possible. Connections capable in this sphere.

shortlist.name: The Electrical Kid (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing 3-2 finishes. Elite trainer Henry de Bromhead with solid jockey booking. Heavy market support indicates strong stable confidence. Proven form and class advantage over field.

shortlist.name: Tell Us This (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won last time out (form starts with '1'). Strong recent form line of 1-8-7 shows competitive level. Cromwell yard in form. Offers value against short-priced favourite with winning momentum.

shortlist.name: Seskin Flash (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form showing 4-1-4 pattern indicates horse reaching peak fitness. Each-way value with place prospects. Pattern suggests improvement trajectory after recent win.

shortlist.name: Small Town Hero (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 4/5 (1.88 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off three consecutive wins, indicating peak form and clear progression. The odds reflect strong market confidence and the horse's recent dominance. No signs of decline in form, and connections have placed the horse well.

shortlist.name: Stretchemout (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice at 16/5 (5.2 exchange), clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Latest run was a win, suggesting a return to form after a patchy spell. Trained by Gordon Elliott and ridden by top jockey J. W. Kennedy, both highly respected. Represents the main threat to the favourite based on connections and recent improvement.

shortlist.name: Kansas (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple placed efforts, including recent seconds and thirds. Trained by a top yard and ridden by a reliable jockey. The odds are short but reflect genuine claims; this horse is proven at the level and does not need to improve to win.

shortlist.name: Ipanema Queen (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts back and has been competitive in better races. The recent ninth is a concern, but prior form is strong for this grade. Odds offer value given connections and proven ability; if bouncing back, has a major chance.

shortlist.name: Sirius A (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a win and multiple places in recent starts. The 'd' (disqualified) is a minor blot but overall profile is solid. Trainer and jockey are capable, and the odds are fair for a horse with proven form at this level.

shortlist.name: Howd'yadoit (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Won two starts ago and has been placed in all but one of last six runs. Trainer is in form and the horse is race-fit. Odds are generous for a horse with this consistency; if reproducing latest win, is a serious player.

shortlist.name: Flawless Fusion (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form and competitive odds make it a top contender. The trainer, Joseph Patrick O'Brien, is well-respected, and the jockey, Declan McDonogh, is experienced.

shortlist.name: Lucia Molly (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with multiple recent placings suggests a strong chance of winning. The odds offer good value compared to its form.

shortlist.name: Sovereign Cry (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.55 exchange (current favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Debuts for a yard with a good record at Dundalk and is the clear market leader. The lack of public form is offset by significant market confidence, suggesting strong homework or positive reports. Jockey booking is notable for a debutant, indicating stable intent.

shortlist.name: World Tour (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.45 exchange (solid second-favourite, holding firm in market)
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections and brings the best exposed form in the field, finishing second last time out. The O'Brien stable excels with this profile at Dundalk, and the horse is proven at the track and trip. Consistent and likely to run to form.

shortlist.name: Sierra De Gredos
shortlist.rationale: Exceptionally consistent form with three wins from last five starts (including two recent victories shown by '12'). Strong recent second place indicates horse is in peak condition. Market support at favourite confirms professional confidence. Form pattern shows improvement trajectory with no signs of decline.

shortlist.name: Oiche Rua (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with two wins and a second from last four starts ('1130'). Current form cycle indicates horse at competitive level. Respected trainer-jockey combination with McGuinness. Fair odds offering value against the favourite given recent winning form.

shortlist.name: Wegotogether (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with two fourth-place finishes. Cromwell is a quality trainer with strong statistics. While lacking a recent win, consistent placings suggest competitive handicap mark. Odds provide value for place potential in competitive field.

shortlist.name: Andab (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows consistency with a strong finish in its last race. Joseph Patrick O'Brien's stable has been performing well.

shortlist.name: Frescobaldi (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Competitive odds at 3.5 on the exchange
shortlist.rationale: Aidan O'Brien's horses often perform well, and Frescobaldi has shown promising form despite a recent dip.

shortlist.name: Cheers Again
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 4.4 exchange (current favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a close third last time out, suggesting peak fitness. Market support is strong, and the horse is proven at this level. Connections are reliable for Dundalk handicaps.

shortlist.name: Ja'marr
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile, regularly placing in competitive fields. Recent runs show reliability and ability to handle the track. Connections are in form and the odds offer fair value for a horse knocking on the door.

shortlist.name: Nocturnal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 7.4 exchange (solid market position, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show improvement, with a third last time out indicating readiness. Trainer is adept at placing horses at Dundalk and the jockey booking is positive. Market suggests respect.

shortlist.name: Sarmiento Power (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form showing clear improvement with back-to-back wins (01). Previous zeros suggest long layoff before current campaign, now hitting peak form. Favourite status justified by current winning run and solid connections.

shortlist.name: Gallo Dell Cielo (Ire)
shortlist.rationale: Recent second place (7) shows competitive form at this level. Consistent mid-pack finishes (666) demonstrate reliability. Odds provide value against favourite, particularly if stepping forward from last run.

shortlist.name: Johnny's Oasis
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth (4) indicates current form, with McGuinness yard in good form. Consistent placings suggest reliable performer at this grade. Odds offer reasonable value as potential improver.

shortlist.name: Zillow
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.2 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a strong win and place record, trained by the top-class W. P. Mullins. Recent form is progressive and the horse is well found in the market, indicating confidence from connections and punters. No signs of regression and profile suggests further improvement likely.

shortlist.name: Heather (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 3.8 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent filly with multiple wins and places this season, trained by a leading yard. Recent form is reliable at this level and she has tactical speed for Dundalk. Market position reflects her genuine claims and she does not require major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Titanium Emperor (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4 exchange (third in betting, competitive odds)
shortlist.rationale: Has been running consistently in competitive company, often not beaten far. Connections are in form and the booking of David Egan is a positive. Profile fits a horse ready to capitalize if the top two underperform, and odds offer fair value for a place or win.

shortlist.name: Grand Sonata (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a leading market contender on US books; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Represents top connections with Todd Pletcher and Tyler Gaffalione, both highly successful at Keeneland. Grand Sonata has graded stakes form and is proven at this level, making him a logical contender if fit. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and bettors.

shortlist.name: Goldeneye (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early betting; not considered an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Irad Ortiz Jr. is a leading jockey with a strong record at Keeneland, and Kenny McPeek is a respected trainer. Goldeneye has shown ability in allowance company and is expected to improve. The combination of top connections and market respect makes this runner a key player.

shortlist.name: San Siro (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Well found in the market; not a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Frankie Dettori is a world-class jockey, and Brendan Walsh is a trainer with a strong Keeneland record. San Siro is lightly raced with upside and has been well supported in early markets, suggesting stable confidence. Connections and potential for improvement make this a strong shortlist candidate.

shortlist.name: Ohana Honor (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Flavien Prat and Shug McGaughey are a formidable team, especially on turf at Keeneland. Ohana Honor is bred for this type of race and has shown promise in previous starts. Market support and connections suggest a strong chance if progressing as expected.

shortlist.name: Whataboutism (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections with trainer A. Fabre and jockey Cristian Demuro, which often indicates a well-prepared horse.

shortlist.name: Al Dhaby (Fr)
shortlist.rationale: Trainer Jean-Claude Rouget is known for producing quality horses, which could give Al Dhaby an edge.

shortlist.name: In Process (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Market leader with the shortest odds, suggesting strong confidence from connections and/or recent private form not reflected in public figures. Trainer and jockey are established in South African racing, and the odds imply a high expectation of performance despite lack of published form.

shortlist.name: Elusive Black (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Second favorite with a solid recent run (4th last time out), suggesting current fitness and competitiveness. Jockey and trainer are reputable, and the odds indicate strong market support. The form string is short but not discouraging for a lightly raced type.

shortlist.name: Holly's Kiss (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Third in the betting with no public form, but the presence of a top jockey and a leading trainer suggests hidden ability. The odds are respectful for a horse with no exposed form, indicating stable confidence and/or promising workouts.

shortlist.name: Speed Racer (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong odds and recent form improvement suggest potential for a win.

shortlist.name: Pop Chart (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong with a second and a win, indicating good current form.

shortlist.name: Travel Master (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent places, suggesting a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Masked Vigilante (Saf)
shortlist.odds_note: Similar odds to Travel Master at 2.12
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent form make it a viable option.

shortlist.name: Lotus Silk (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent runner-up effort signals peaking form. Top local jockey and trainer combination. Odds reflect market confidence and form cycle analysis suggests further improvement likely.

shortlist.name: Touch The Sword (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent third after an eighth shows positive progression. Trainer is reliable at this venue. Form cycle indicates an upward trend, and odds are competitive for a win chance.

shortlist.name: Golden Croc (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings, including two seconds, suggest the horse is fit and holding form. Connections are in good order and odds offer fair value for a reliable performer.

shortlist.name: Money Galore (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Regularly competitive with multiple placings in recent starts. Jockey is experienced and the horse is fit, making this a credible contender at fair odds.

shortlist.name: New Mexico (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Comes in off back-to-back wins, indicating peak form. Has a strong recent record and is trained by a respected local handler. The odds reflect strong market confidence, and there is no sign of decline in the form cycle.

shortlist.name: Arabian Red (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins this season and a top jockey booked. Recent form is solid, and the horse has shown the ability to compete at this level. Connections are strong, and the odds are fair for a likely contender.

shortlist.name: Back For More (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with a win in the last race, indicating strong current form.

shortlist.name: Amazing Colours (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form and competitive odds suggest a strong contender.

shortlist.name: Blackberry Breeze (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows some consistency, and odds suggest a strong chance.

shortlist.name: Global Speak (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win indicates improving form, making it a contender.

shortlist.name: Olive Oyl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent form with recent strong finishes, offering value at slightly longer odds.

shortlist.name: Symbol Of Love (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form with three podium finishes in last four starts (2-2-3). Trainer E. Kaknis has two runners, suggesting stable confidence. Current form trend shows horse is on the improve after mid-season struggles. Joint favorite status reflects market confidence.

shortlist.name: Bonjour La Ville (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Excellent recent form with win last time out (1) following consistent placings (1-9-1-5). Horse is clearly at peak fitness with multiple wins in recent form cycle. Odds of 3.0 represent genuine value given current winning form and consistency.

shortlist.name: Kings Again (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong finishing form with two wins and a second in last three starts (3-3-1). Top jockey Richard Fourie booked. Trainer A. C. Greeff is proven at this venue. Form pattern shows horse hitting peak after finding stride mid-campaign.

shortlist.name: Instaworthy (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win followed by consistent placings (1-6-6-3-3). Proven ability at this level with victory in recent form. G. D. Smith stable in good form. Odds of 3.75 offer value for a horse with winning form and consistency.

shortlist.name: Silvan Mistress (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and two wins in last six starts. Top local jockey and trainer combination. Odds offer value for a runner proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Faraway Girl (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and two placings in last three runs. Reliable connections and recent form suggest readiness for another strong showing.

shortlist.name: Supreme Judge (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings (2-2-2) showing clear improvement trend. Strong trainer-jockey combination with G.D. Smith stable in form. Fourth place finish followed by sustained quality runs indicates horse has found optimal form level.

shortlist.name: The Roaring Rock (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with back-to-back wins (2-2-1 recent finishes) demonstrating upward trajectory. A.C. Greeff is leading trainer at Fairview. Current form suggests horse peaking at right time with winning momentum.

shortlist.name: Away With Red (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Strong recent form line showing three consecutive placings and a win (3-2-2-1). Proven consistency at this level with improving trend. Odds offer value given solid recent performances and winning form.

shortlist.name: Buffalo Bill (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes and a win in last four starts. Short odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are reliable and horse is peaking at the right time.

shortlist.name: Galileo Star (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and a second from only two starts, indicating untapped potential. Trainer and jockey are both respected locally. Market support suggests further improvement likely.

shortlist.name: Ravilious (Saf)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is excellent, winning two of last three and placing consistently. Connections in good form and odds indicate solid market respect. Proven at this level and distance.
